detail.content: Andean Initiative, Center for Latin American and Caribbean Studies (CLACS) | NYU                           NEW YORK UNIVERSITY       ARTS AND SCIENCE       COLLEGE OF ARTS AND SCIENCE       GRADUATE SCHOOL OF ARTS AND SCIENCE                                                                                                             About Us       People       Undergraduate       Graduate Program       Faculty Resources       Alumni Network       Caribbean Initiative       Andean Initiative       Quechua Language       K-12 Outreach       Events               Home > Andean Initiative     Andean Initiative   The CLACS-NYC Andean Institute was launched in 2009 as a material and virtual resource to promote regional training and outreach related to the peoples and countries of the Andean region. This region follows the Andes mountain chain from Colombia through Ecuador, Peru, and Bolivia, to Chile and NW Argentina. The Institute draws upon the CLACS commitment to Quechua language training , the depth of expertise on the region among CLACS Affiliated Faculty at NYU, and the large number of Andeanists at other NYC-area institutions, as well as the presence of a vibrant Andeanist and Andean community around the city.  The Andean Institute brings together faculty, students, research, academic debate, and outreach resources. It also hosts colloquia, conferences, and Andean-related events , as well as promotes courses about the Andes. The Institute is proud to offer Quechua language courses , and also sponsors a monthly Quechua language conversation night which is open to the public.  Through this website, the Institute fosters a virtual community for the diffusion of new research, providing a space for dynamic dialogue. We are proud that the Andean Institute connects communities within the NYC area, and serves as a bridge between the NYC region and Andean countries.
